docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18. -- Praise of what it called "the Hull trade program" was given by the Foreign Policy Association in a report made public today, written by David H. Popper of its research staff. The report held that tariff reductions have been...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18. -- Praise of what it called "the Hull trade program" was given by the Foreign Policy Association in a report made public today, written by David H. Popper of its research staff. The report held that tariff reductions have been handled with "such caution and technical skill that it appears no efficient industry has been substantially injured."
docs.abstract: Foreign Policy Assn rept commends Hull program

headline.main: HULL COMMENDED FOR TRADE PACTS; Foreign Policy Association Sees Tariff Cuts Handled With 'Technical Skill.' BREACH MADE IN BARRIERS Secretary Will Renew Efforts for Pan-American Commerce at Buenos Aires Parley.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The foreign exchange market showed comparative steadiness last week. Business was in fair volume, representing as it did buying by commercial interests in preparation for legitimate requirements, coupled with covering by "shorts" who had overstayed...
docs.lead_paragraph: The foreign exchange market showed comparative steadiness last week. Business was in fair volume, representing as it did buying by commercial interests in preparation for legitimate requirements, coupled with covering by "shorts" who had overstayed the market in anticipation of lower values.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED OCT. 17, 1936

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Oct. 19. -- Diplomatic quarters here today characterized as critical the situation that has arisen between the Spanish Government and South American republics as a result of the insistence of the Latin-American governments on...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Oct. 19. -- Diplomatic quarters here today characterized as critical the situation that has arisen between the Spanish Government and South American republics as a result of the insistence of the Latin-American governments on their right to extend asylum to political refugees in Madrid.
docs.abstract: situation critical as result of insistence of Latin-Amer govts on their rights; legations reptd to have purchased arms to defend refugees against possible mob violence; Madrid govt charges abuse of principle, alleging that 4 of 5 refugees expatriated by Argentine Amb, returned to join Rebels; Argentine Foreign Min, C Saavedra Lamas, in Paris leading Latin-Amer movement

headline.main: UNITED BLOC FACES SPAIN ON REFUGEES; Latin-American States Push Drive for Recognition of Right to Give Asylum.

docs.snippet: PARIS, Oct. 23 (AP). -- The Spanish Government tonight notified Carlos Saavedra Lamas, Argentine Foreign Minister, that it had granted authorization for the departure from besieged Madrid of Spanish women and children refugees sheltered in the...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Oct. 23 (AP). -- The Spanish Government tonight notified Carlos Saavedra Lamas, Argentine Foreign Minister, that it had granted authorization for the departure from besieged Madrid of Spanish women and children refugees sheltered in the Argentine Embassy.
docs.abstract: Madrid govt grants authorization for evacuation of women and children refugees in Argentine Embassy; Saavedra Lamas hopes for extension

headline.main: ARGENTINA OBTAINS VICTORY IN MADRID; Spanish Women and Children in Embassy Will Be Taken by Envoy to France.

docs.snippet: An erratic movement in the French franc on Thursday which carried it down to 4.60 1/2 cents, a new low since devaluation, stood out as the only change of importance in the foreign currency market last week.
docs.lead_paragraph: An erratic movement in the French franc on Thursday which carried it down to 4.60 1/2 cents, a new low since devaluation, stood out as the only change of importance in the foreign currency market last week.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK EENDED OCT. 24, 1936

docs.snippet: Rising trends predominated yesterday in bond trading on the New York Stock Exchange. Shaking off the uncertainty that had restricted activities in the more speculative issues on Wednesday, the market for those issues responded readily to a brisk...
docs.lead_paragraph: Rising trends predominated yesterday in bond trading on the New York Stock Exchange. Shaking off the uncertainty that had restricted activities in the more speculative issues on Wednesday, the market for those issues responded readily to a brisk demand which carried many of the pivotal loans up sharply on the day.

headline.main: BOND PRICES RISE IN HEAVIER TRADE; Brisk Demand Buoys the More Speculative Issues on the Stock Exchange. FEDERAL OBLIGATIONS UP Foreign Loans Irregular in Dull Market -- Trend Is Higher on the Curb.

docs.snippet: Credit and collection conditions in Latin-American nations during the third quarter of this year showed a decline compared with previous quarters of the year, according to the survey released yesterday by the foreign credit interchange bureau of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Credit and collection conditions in Latin-American nations during the third quarter of this year showed a decline compared with previous quarters of the year, according to the survey released yesterday by the foreign credit interchange bureau of the National Association of Credit Men.

headline.main: LATIN AMERICA CREDIT DOWN DURING QUARTER; Survey of National Association Shows Moderate Declines in Collections Also.
